STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 14, 2024
Kimberlee LeFear
Genesee County DHHS
125 E Union ST.
FLINT, MI, 48502-2036
RE: License#: CP250201139
Dear Ms. LeFear:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at (517)243 -9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
FOM POLICY 722-08D TREATMENT PLANS – AGREEMENT AND SIGNATURES
Once completed and approved the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
Caseworker, Supervisor, second line supervisor, when
siblings in care are place apart, parents who are a
member of a participating household. Youth ages 14
and older. Foster parents, relative caregivers, and
unrelated court -ordered caregivers. Parents/legal
guardians, youth, and caregivers must check yes or no
for the following when signing the treatment plan: I
have participated in the Development of the Case
service plan and Parent Agency Treatment Plan.
Six open foster care files and 19 service plans were reviewed. Four of 19 PATPs
were either missing PATP signatures, signatures were not obtained within 30
days of the updated service plans and yes or no was not checked indicating
participation of the updated service plan.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
RENEWAL DATED 4/8/22, CAP APPROVED 4/18/22.
INTERIM DATED 6/28/23, CAP APPROVED 7/9/23.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
• Technical Assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas.
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. Special evaluation #2023C0631037 was generated on 10/14/2022 regarding
allegations the caregiver was utilizing corporal punishment as discipline. Law
enforcement and DHHS were involved and the agency completed their report on
12/19/2023. The Caregiver was found in violation with licensing rules 400.9404 (3)
and 400.9201 (1,K). Caregiver was placed on central registry and their license was
revoked.
There were one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. As indicated above, special evaluation #2023C0631037 was generated on
10/14/2022 regarding allegations the caregiver was utilizing corporal punishment as
discipline. Law enforcement and DHHS were involved and the agency completed
their report on 12/19/2023. The Caregiver was found in violation with licensing rules
400.9404 (3) and 400.9201 (1,K). Caregiver was placed on central registry and their
license was revoked.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with the individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan in response to the interim
inspection completed on 6/28/2023 with the corrective action plan approved on
7/19/2023. The agency received a citation with FOM Policy 722-08D. The agency
continues to struggle in this area as there is a repeat violation during this reporting
period for this policy.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed in the exit
conference held on 3/5/2024. The Chief Administrator (CA) identified barriers the
agency faces within the last two years involving caseload responsibilities, staff
turnover, employee labor relation/performance issues, placement limitations for
youth in foster care causing additional oversight with services. The CA reported
the uploading of documents to various areas of MiSACWIS continues to be an
ongoing challenge for staff and high attention has been placed in this area. The

CA reported overall their numbers are high and she expressed confidence that
during the next review period all areas will improve.
Financial Overview
Not applicable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The staff interviewed feel highly supported by upper management, their
supervisors, and coworkers. One staff stated she would change the amount of
paperwork they have to do on a daily basis to spend more time with their assigned
families. The staff reported no safety concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency appears to have adequate space and equipment to perform required
job duties. Files are stored securely and in a manner that provides unauthorized
access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The youth were interviewed by the DCWL Analyst, and no safety concerns were
reported.
There was one safety alert:
Safety Alert:
There was no smoke detector in the basement where the separate sleeping area is
located for the two youths in the home. The hot tub does not have a safety cover
that can be locked and there is no safety plan for the pool/hot tub.
Resolution:
A special evaluation was opened on 1/19/2024 on the home as a result of the safety
alert. A home visit was held, and the worker observed the smoke detector in place
and working in the basement. The worker observed the hot tub drained, deflated,
and disassembled. A discussion was held with the caregiver regarding the hot tub
not being filled until approval is given by DCWL. A safety plan was dated and
signed by the caregiver. Photos of completion are attached to the safety alert.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
3/12/2024
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
03/14/2024
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
